Interface_name: HTTP Server - side by using Flask in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Flask-based API server that can handle multiple routes for status checking, input processing, and server management, with the ability to run in a separate thread or using a production server.

Class Description: FlaskAPI is a class that encapsulates a Flask web server with custom routes for handling API requests. It provides methods to start and stop the server either in a development thread or using a production-ready server (Waitress).

Attributes:
- app: Flask - The Flask application instance
- server_thread: ServerThread - Thread object for running the development server

Methods:
- __init__() -> None - Initializes the Flask application and sets up routes
- _setup_routes() -> None - Defines the API endpoints and their handlers
- _the_input(text: str, screen: str, talk: str) -> dict - Processes input text and optional screenshot, returns response
- start_api(api: bool = False) -> None - Starts the server either in a thread (api=False) or using Waitress (api=True)
- stop_api() -> None - Stops the running server thread

Nested Class: ServerThread
Class Description: A thread class for running the Flask development server in a separate thread.

Attributes:
- srv: WSGIServer - The Werkzeug development server instance
- ctx: AppContext - Flask application context

Methods:
- __init__(app: Flask, host: str, port: int) -> None - Initializes the server thread with Flask app and connection details
- run() -> None - Starts the server and runs it indefinitely
- shutdown() -> None - Stops the running server
